brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts a wired and wireless network, each with a PC, IP phones, and TV communicating with a central router.

Wired networks use physical cables to connect devices. The wired network uses solid lines to represent physical cables to connect devices. Photographs of UTP cable with RJ-45 connectors are shown.

Wireless networks use radio waves, represented by wavy lines, to communicate between devices. Wireless networks are also connected to wired networks at some point.
